derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as infiltration): from in- + filtrate

entry.tran: 渗透，潜入(地方、组织中等)
entry.def: If people infiltrate a place or organization, or infiltrate into it, they enter it secretly in order to spy on it or influence it.

example.ex: Activists had infiltrated the student movement...
example.tran: 激进分子已经渗入到了学生运动中。

example.ex: The street protests had been infiltrated by people bent on violence...
example.tran: 街头抗议的人群中已经渗入了一些倾向于暴力的人。

entry.def: To infiltrate people into a place or organization means to get them into it secretly in order to spy on it or influence it.

example.ex: Some countries have infiltrated their agents into the Republic.
example.tran: 一些国家已派间谍渗入了该共和国内部。

means.word_mean: 1. cause (a liquid) to enter by penetrating the interstices
2. enter a group or organization in order to spy on the members;

sentences.sentence: "The student organization was infiltrated by a traitor"

means.word_mean: 3. pass into or through by filtering or permeating;
4. pass through an enemy-line; in a military conflict

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表名词,"人或地位等"; 2. 表形容词,"具有……的"; 3. 表动词,"做,造成;使"
